definition: brake lever/crank handle for stopping or turning off machinery
Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: "Good morning, Mr. Chen?" he greeted the driller who was holding the brake handle.
sentences.chinese: “早上好，陳明？”他向扶剎把的司鑽問候道。

sentences.english: The ma new good operating brsimilarg system bar is our driller.
sentences.chinese: 操作剎把的那個人是我們的司鑽。

sentences.english: This type of soft lever is inherently more difficult to control.
sentences.chinese: 這種軟的剎把天生更難於控制。

sentences.english: The man who operates a brake is a driller.
Brake handle component is main simulation part of drilling simulator.
sentences.chinese: 剎把組件是鑽井模擬器上的主要仿真部分。

sentences.english: The amount of lever stroke required to increase the amount of brake power generated is minimal.
sentences.chinese: 增加制動力所需的剎把行程是最小的。

sentences.english: The man operating brake bar is our driller.
sentences.chinese: 操作剎把的那個人是我們的司鑽。
